Resolved Question Show me another » Would you take a job in retail or fast food restaurant? So long story story short I got offered two jobs one at Burger King and another at Ross. I don't know which to choose. I've never worked in retail or fast food. I have pros and cons for both jobs one being Burger King is really close to my house I don't even need to drive I could just walk there and Ross it's a bit far. Another is that Ross seems like a more fun place to work at and you get discounts in clothing:) Which do you think is better to work at? 1 year ago Report Abuse by Musicall... Member since: July 30, 2011 Total points: 160 (Level 1) Add Contact Block
Best Answer - Chosen by Asker I would work retail. Working in the fast food industry is one of the least gratifying jobs out there- I would know, I do it every day- the work is hard, long and tiring. You have to deal with people and food. Those two things don't mix well. People get very angry over their food. Also, their demeanor towards you is quite negative. I was an honors student in high school and am going to college in the fall. Simply because I work in fast food does not mean I am an idiot. So yeah, given the choice between the two I would definitely work at a clothing store. 1 year ago Report Abuse
2 people rated this as good Asker's Rating: Asker's Comment: thanks! all were good answers:) and yeah everyone seems to say that even my family and friends so I think I will be taking the job at Ross. I am also going to start college this fall and I would never think someone working at a fast food place would be considered dumb at least that person has a job. If the extra money isn't important go for the retail job, the overall climate comfort and lack of greasy floors is great. 1 year ago Report Abuse
